Key Match Events: Guatemala took a surprise lead after four minutes, Lisandro Martinez turning a set piece into his own goal.
Argentina soon responded when goalkeeper Nicholas Hagen skewed a clearance to Messi's feet, allowing the captain to pass the ball into an empty net.
Martinez gave La Albiceleste the lead after 39 minutes, tucking a penalty into the bottom corner.

Argentina turned it on after the break. Martinez made it three to top off a wonderfully crafted move - Enzo Fernandez finding Messi, who cut back to the striker for an easy finish into an open net. Messi bagged a fourth to kill the game for good, converting an Angel Di Maria pass with a delightful dink.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Scaloni kept Messi in, but made some big calls in defence. He will be disappointed to see his team concede so early, but take heart from the quick recovery. Argentina played at half of their usual quality and grabbed themselves a convincing win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina won the match 4-1 against Guatemala.
The match was a Copa America warmup friendly.
Argentina's players, including Lionel Messi and Lautaro Martinez, received player ratings from GOAL.
Others: Argentina's starting XI included Emi Martinez, Nahuel Molina, Nicolas Otamendi, Lisandro Martinez, Nico Gonzalez, Valentin Carboni, Enzo Fernandez, Alexis Mac Allister, Giovani Lo Celso, Lionel Messi, and Lautaro Martinez.
Argentina's substitutes included Angel Di Maria, Rodrigo De Paul, Leandro Paredes, Julian Alvarez, Lucas Quarta, and Lionel Scaloni.
